item.title: [+2337] Why American Media Sucks .... A tale of 4 Newsweek Covers

item.description: This thing is awesome, can't stop watching. For added MJ effects hit S, D, F, J, K and L!

item.title: [+2282] Police Invade Wisconsin man's property to pull down flag hun
item.description: The Washington post says "An American flag flown upside down as a protest in a northern Wisconsin village was seized by police before a Fourth of July parade and the businessman who flew it - an Iraq war veteran - claims the officers trespassed and stole his property. "

item.title: [+1909] ...And I Blame These People For Everything Wrong In The U.S.
[+1763] Stephen Hawking: Why Isn't the Milky Way Crawling With Life?
item.description: "What are the chances that we will encounter some alien form of life, as we explore the galaxy?" If the argument about the time scale for the appearance of life on Earth is correct, Hawking says "there ought to be many other stars, whose planets have life on them. Some of these stellar systems could have formed 5 billion years before the Earth.

item.title: [+1621] Coolest Slow-Mo Bubble Popping Picture You'll Ever See
item.description: The images were taken with a slow-motion camera to show every stage of the soap bubble's disappearance.

item.title: [+1590] NHS Recommends Pupils have an 'orgasm a day'
item.description: The UK Nationa Health Service is telling pupils they have a 'right' to an enjoyable sex life in a leaflet being sent to schools. It encourages them to consider an 'orgasm a day' as a way reduce the risk of heart attacks and stroke. And if they can't get sex, the leaflet says children should consider masturbation!

item.title: [+1549] Kids In My Neighborhood 1) rock 2) rule 3) need a life
[+1540] Redneck Houseboat FTW!
[+1539] Best. Sandwich. EVAR. Really. And, yes, there's bacon
item.description: A half pound duck and pork patty, cheddar cheese, seven pieces of maple bacon, sauteed onions and zillion island sauce on a kaiser roll. You had me at "A" - by the way, the name of this sandwich, for some reason, is Mork's Dork from Ork. Whatever. Still doesn't spoil the awesomeness that is this sandwich.

item.title: [+1475] Dennis Kucinich Demolishes Wingnut Doc on Healthcare
item.description: "I'm not surprised that psychiatrist David Gratzer testified this week that the Canadian healthcare system is just awful and how the poor deprived Canadians are simply pouring across the border... Oddly enough, he forgot to mention that the Canadian government was not only sending them across the border, they were picking up the check."

item.title: [+1267] Identify yourself! Wait...you're a cardboard cutout! [Pic]
[+1222] Stephen Fry Admits He’s a BitTorrent Pirate
item.description: Stephen Fry, a highly respected actor, comedian, writer, presenter and author yesterday admitted to downloading TV shows for free using BitTorrent. Speaking at the iTunes Festival in London last night, Fry told the audience that he’s grabbed episodes of 24 and the series finale of House, starring his former comedy partner Hugh Laurie.

item.title: [+1033] Nudity Does Us All Good
item.description: Channel 4's Life Class delivers an important lesson on the human form, whatever the moral guardians of daytime TV say, writes Jemima Lewis.

item.title: [+912] CBS Poll Finds Record Support for Legalizing Marijuana
item.description: With a New CBS News Poll Finding 41% Now Support Legalization, CBSNews.com Examines Changing Views of Marijuana in the U.S.

item.title: [+900] What Charlie Brown would look like in real life (PIC)
item.description: What if I were to paint a realistic version of something usually thought of as cute and benign? For no particular reason and maybe several, I chose Charlie Brown.

item.title: [+817] Sarah Palin's Messy Exit Strategy Could Really Cost Alaska
item.description: Since her sudden resignation from the Alaskan governor’s office on July 3, Sarah Palin has created a constitutional crisis that could cost state legislators hundreds of thousands in taxpayer money to resolve.
